sen.e: This is a kind of mono zukushi (list of things) or shokunin zukushi (list of craftsmen), in which the author listed social conditions, trades, public entertainment, and culture under the pretense of a man who went to see sarugaku (a medieval Noh farce) at Kyo one night.

sen.j: 通説では作者藤原明衡の晩年である天喜年間（1053年 - 1058年）あるいは康平年間（1058年 - 1065年）とするが、長元元年（1028年）とする説もある。
sen.e: But there are some common views; it was completed during the Tengi era (1053-1058), when the author FUJIWARA no Akihira was in his later years, during the Kohei era (1058-1065), or the first year of the Chogen era.

But there are two widely held views that it was either completed during the Tengi era (1053-1058), when the author FUJIWARA no Akihira was in his later years, during the Kohei era (1058-1065), or the first year of the Chogen era.

sen.j: 冒頭の作者署名に右京大夫と官名が記されており、明衡が右京大夫に任官した記録は他にないが、事実とすればこれが彼の極官であったことから、晩年の作であろうとする見解が多いだけである。
sen.e: He signed his name and official title of Ukyo no Daibu (Right City Commissioner) on the beginning page of the book, and if it is true, though there is no record of his being appointed as Ukyo no Daibu, it would be his final title, which is the only reason why many people suppose that the work was written in his later years.

sen.j: 形勾当の面現（けいこうとうのひたおもて）
sen.e: Unmasked face of the servant Kei
sen.cmt: 以下は『新猿楽記』（東洋文庫）の解説ですが、ここにも書いてあるとおり、形勾当の意味ははっきりしないようです。とりあえず、"Traditional Japanese arts and culture"を参照して、「servant Kei」としておきました。「仮面劇を演ずる時に、役者の都合で刑勾当とよばれる寺の所司が面をつけないで直面で出演したとも解せられるが、後宮の勾当内侍が、簾中に奉仕しているべきはずのところを軽率にも簾外に素顔を出したこっけいを演ずる物真似と解すべきであろうか。何れもきめ手はなく、疑問がのこる。刑の意味もわからない。近親に刑部官のいる勾当内侍ででもあろうか。形勾当かもわからない。」
sen.e: Unmasked face of the servant Kei

sen.j: 牛馬を休ませる暇もなく、常に運送料や荷車のことで争っている。
sen.e: He does not have time to rest his cows and horses, and is always arguing with people about shipping charges and carts.

sen.j: 尊大で人に頭を下げるということを知らないが、靴を脱ぐ暇もなく、足にひびやあかぎれをつくりながらただ家族のために働いている。
sen.e: Though he is arrogant and does not know how to plead with others, he works for his family so hard that he can't take off his shoes, getting chapped feet.

sen.j: その風貌は、目は墨壷のようで曲直を正し、歯は鋸のよう、首は手斧のよう、さいづち頭（木槌のように額と後頭部のでっぱった頭）で、指は墨刺（竹の筆）、肘は曲尺（直角に曲がったものさし）、肩は南蛮錐の柄のよう、足は金づちと、まさに生まれついての大工である。
sen.e: His appearance shows that he is an innate carpenter, because he has eyes like an inkpot, clarifying what is right and what is wrong, and has saw-like teeth, an adze-like neck, a mallet-shaped head (his forehead and the back of the head protrude like a mallet), fingers like a bamboo brushes, elbows like a carpenter's square, shoulders like the Southern barbarian gimlet, and hammer-shaped feet.
